channel.title: Client Run help
channel.description:
Hey guys, when ever I try to run my client, this is what happens:
[code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: EGUI Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: EGUI at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClassInternal(Unknown Source) Could not find the main class: EGUI. Program will exit.[/code]
please help

item.title: Client Run help
item.dc:creator: @Mercifies Mercifies
item.description:
@Mercifies wrote:

Here is mine:

@ECHO OFF echo Running Client JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI

Same thing as Lewis’s[br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 08, 2009, 04:25:26 am[/size][hr]I also have a second run but gets same error. Here is code of that:

@echo off java -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui

Please Help :([br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 08, 2009, 05:32:27 pm[/size][hr]anybody? [br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 09, 2009, 04:30:18 pm[/size][hr]bump

Read full topic

item.title: Client Run help
item.dc:creator: @Lewis3 Lewis)
item.description:
@Lewis3 wrote:

@ECHO OFF echo ##server name here## echo blah blah blah JAVA -Xmx500m EGUI

Replace your run.bat with this and tell me if this works.

Read full topic

item.title: Client Run help
item.dc:creator: @IceTICKER IceTICKER
item.description:
@IceTICKER wrote:

Did you remove EGUI From Your Client, Because thats the problem or you don’t have one.
